feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On Rivers Across The Southeast Interior This Week... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are near bankfull. This is due to high freezing levels causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. Periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior Sunday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Expected Wednesday And Wednesday Night... Snow is expected from after midnight tonight through Wednesday night. Little accumulation is expected as the snow should melt as it hits the ground.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Expected Wednesday And Wednesday Night... Snow is expected from after midnight tonight through Wednesday night. Less than one inch of accumulation is expected below 3000 feet. Above 3000 feet, between 2 and 5 inches of snow is expected, with the highest amounts above 5000 feet.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 12 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Central Interior. This includes the cities of Nenana, Tanana, Manley Hot Springs, and Old Minto.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive snow melt and rainfall is expected along the Tanana River. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Delta Junction downstream to Bonanza Creek, including the following areas, Deltana and Tanana Flats and Middle Tanana Valley. entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 12 at 10:39AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet, increasing to 11 to 13 feet tonight, will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...Through the new week * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 12 at 8:03PM PDT until July 13 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot, Dry, and Windy Conditions Wednesday Afternoon... .Abnormally hot conditions under the ridge has already created critically dry conditions east of the Cascades. As an upper level trough moves in behind the ridge, winds during the afternoon will become gusty. This will result in critical conditions Wednesday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 4:10PM PDT until July 13 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Benewah, southwestern Kootenai and southeastern Spokane Counties through 1230 AM PDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 11:57PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Benewah, southwestern Kootenai and southeastern Spokane Counties through 1230 AM PDT... At 1156 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Plummer, or 22 miles south of Spokane Valley, moving northeast at 40 mph.
